materials.raw_text: B: 6 g Co: 20 g Li: 1 g V: 2 g

sourcing.instructions: B: Purchase from a chemical supply store (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich). Co: Obtain from a metal supplier or online marketplace (e.g., Amazon). Li: Available at specialized battery material suppliers. V: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online resource.
steps: B: Purchase from a chemical supply store (e.g., Sigma-Aldrich). Co: Obtain from a metal supplier or online marketplace (e.g., Amazon). Li: Available at specialized battery material suppliers. V: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online resource.

1. Measure 6 g of B (Boron). 2. Measure 20 g of Co (Cobalt). 3. Measure 1 g of Li (Lithium). 4. Measure 2 g of V (Vanadium). 5. In a clean, dry mortar and pestle, combine all materials and thoroughly grind until a homogeneous powder is achieved. 6. Transfer the mixed powder into a clean container for the next step.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 6 g of B (Boron). 2. Measure 20 g of Co (Cobalt). 3. Measure 1 g of Li (Lithium). 4. Measure 2 g of V (Vanadium). 5. In a clean, dry mortar and pestle, combine all materials and thoroughly grind until a homogeneous powder is achieved. 6. Transfer the mixed powder into a clean container for the next step.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the container with the mixed powder inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired material.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the container with the mixed powder inside the furnace. 3. Heat for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired material.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). 2. Ensure the material is fully cooled before handling.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 1-2 hours). 2. Ensure the material is fully cooled before handling.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the furnace. 2. Use sandpaper (600-grit) to smooth the surface of the solid to achieve the desired dimensions and finish. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant if the material requires environmental protection. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before use.
